sprite.name: (Unused) Large Object Thrower
sprite.notes:
Used in the Newer Final Boss Fight. This is spawned through Captain Bowser's code. It will throw a larger version of the Projectile at a 45° arc.

Use of this sprite is not recommended.
sprite.advancednotes: This sprite is best made use of by spawning it through the Actor Spawner. Projectiles have a very high velocity. It will spawn the object around 5 blocks above the placement of the sprite.

dependency.notes: [95] Hammer Bros is required to be placed in the level if using this sprite with the Object: Hammer setting.

dualbox.comment: This determines the Z-Order of the thrown object.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
Place in Front: +3300 to the Z-Order.
Place Behind: -1804 to the Z-Order.

list.title: Object
list.comment: This determines what object is thrown. These objects are larger than the normal versions.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the object will be thrown.

sprite.name: Toad House Minigame - Silver Star
sprite.notes: A collection challenge added in NewerSMBW. The player must collect all of the stars within the time limit in order to succeed and trigger an event.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This determines which Event will be activated when all Collectible Stars in the Zone are collected.

list.title: Minimum Number of Players
list.comment: This determines the minimum number of players required to be present for this start to spawn.

sprite.name: Rideable Clowncar with Cannon
sprite.notes:
Used in the NewerSMBW Final Boss Fight. The player can fly around freely and shoot a cannon at a fixed angle.

Not recommended for use outside of the Final Boss Fight.
sprite.advancedcomment: If you do choose to use this vehicle outside of the boss fight, please keep in mind there is no documentation for what issues you might encounter. Be sure to test your level for crashes and glitches. Cannon shots behave similarly but not identically to Bob-omb explosions. Water causes it to react similarly to Yoshi, with the player jumping off and the Clowncar sinking.

value.title: Minimum Number of Players
value.comment: This determines the number of players required for the Clowncar to load. A value of 4 will only load if there are 4 players.

checkbox.title: Use Cannon
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the clown car will have the cannon seen in the NewerSMBW Final Boss Fight.

sprite.name: (Unused) Captain Bowser Flame Breath
sprite.notes:
Captain Bowser uses this in the NewerSMBW Final Boss Fight.

Cannot be placed as an individual sprite.

sprite.name: Toad House Minigame - Music House
sprite.notes: This sprite is used to generate the Music House bonus game from NewerSMBW. The blocks will spawn centered on the sprite's placement. Playing the mini-game to completion will cause the level to end in completion.
sprite.advancednotes: Additional songs can be added with a little adjustment to the sprite's code. Simple edits can allow for new songs in your hack.

list.title: 1st Chord Prize
list.comment: This determines the prize awarded for passing the first Chord of the song.

list.title: 2nd Chord Prize
list.comment: This determines the prize awarded for passing the second Chord of the song.

list.title: 3rd Chord Prize
list.comment: This determines the prize awarded for passing the third Chord of the song.

list.title: 4th Chord Prize
list.comment: This determines the prize awarded for passing the fourth Chord of the song.

list.title: Song
list.comment: This determines the song that must be played in the minigame. The number of Stars (*) represents the difficulty. The world the song was used within in Newer is listed in parentheses.

checkbox.title: Always used in NewerSMBW
checkbox.comment: Unknown effect.
checkbox.advancedcomment: While this is always used in NewerSMBW's Music Houses, there's no discernable difference between having this enabled and not.

sprite.name: Bomb Drop Controller
sprite.yoshinotes: The Bomb Dropper does work with Yoshi. When the player is hit and he's on Yoshi, he will dismount Yoshi.
sprite.notes: When one of the Triggering Events is activated, this controller will drop a large exploding spiked ball on either Bowser or a specific player.
sprite.advancednotes: Feeling adventurous? Try making a multiplayer level that uses this sprite to create a versus style game which disables player respawn and triggers an event when only one player is left alive.

value.title: Triggering Event ID #1
value.comment: Two different Event IDs can trigger the same bomb drop.

value.title: Triggering Event ID #2
value.comment: Two different Event IDs can trigger the same bomb drop.

list.title: Target
list.comment: This determines which target the bomb will drop above. Players have the ability to outrun the bomb.

sprite.name: Lighting - Music House Glow Block
sprite.notes: These are the colored Glow Blocks that act like normal blocks. They can be spawned by [15] in NewerSMBW's Music Houses. They can either be used as decoration, or as an item block.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the glow block will play a note when struck or award an item.

list.title: Item
list.comment: This determines the item rewarded.
list.comment2: [Bug] Block will award unlimited items.
list.advancedcomment: The block can be set to both award an item and play a musical note, but it is not recommended.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the glow block.
list.comment2: Value 0 has no recolour in the 'block_light.arc' file. If a color (white) was added, it would work fine.

list.title: Color & Note
list.comment: This determines which note is played when a player hits the block.
list.comment2: <font color="Red">*[Bug] Value 0: Nothing - C1♯ currently crashes the game.</font>

sprite.name: Goomba
sprite.notes: Your standard Goomba. Place it in the level and it will walk towards Mario when it loads.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Goomba.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Goomba placing it further behind other sprites.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This determines what animation state is used by the Goomba when it is first loaded. This is useful for Goombas within range of a nearby Entrance.
list.comment2: Jumps and 'Tumble' will result in it landing on the next platform below where it was initially placed.

sprite.name: Paragoomba
sprite.notes: A Goomba with wings that will flutter towards Mario when it loads.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Paragoomba.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Paragoomba placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Buzzy Beetle
sprite.notes: A standard Buzzy Beetle enemy that walks towards the player when it loads. It will turn around when it reaches ledges and blocks are treated the same as terrain. It will turn around if it walks into lava, but die if it falls into it.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Buzzy Beetle.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Buzzy Beetle will be upside-down and able to cling to and walk on ceilings if placed adjacent to them. If not placed adjacent, he will immediately fall and spin towards the player.

checkbox.title: Inside Shell
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Buzzy Beetle will spawn inside his shell. He will eventually climb out and resume walking, even if set to be upside-down. Upside-down shells will fall without spinning towards the player.

sprite.name: Spiny / Nipper Plant
sprite.notes: A Spiny that walks along the ground.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spiny.
list.comment2: Any Spiny that uses the Balled Up animation will initially use the original red color. Additionally, the Sidestepper's shell has no texture, so it flickers through all the other colors.

list.title: Load-In Animation
list.comment: This will determine which animation state is used by the Spiny when it is first loaded.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11
checkbox.advancedcomment: Unused flag with unknown effects.

sprite.name: Upside-Down Spiny
sprite.notes: An upside-down Spiny that clings to the ceiling. They will only function when attached to flat ceilings, and do not follow slopes or walk around edges. When placed mid-air, they will fall and attack upon loading.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spiny.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 8
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in retail Ambush Stages. Causes a bugged attribute if the Spiny is placed non-adjacent to ceiling terrain with this checked. Unknown purpose.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 06-02. May relate to how the Spiny interacts with slanted terrain, blocks, POW effects, or causes the Spiny to load from much further away.

sprite.name: Grey Tiled Block
sprite.notes: This is a resizable stone block that was not used in retail NSMBW. Be aware that you cannot synchronize this block for level-wide timing purposes.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines how tall the block is.

list.title: Width
list.comment: This determines how wide the block is.

list.title: Movement Direction
list.comment: This determines the initial direction the block will travel.

checkbox.title: Offset Delay
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will wait two game seconds before moving the first time. This is important for adjusting timing in athletic levels.

value.title: Delay Before Movement
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its outwards movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

value.title: Distance
value.comment: This defines how many tiles the block will move before returning to its starting position.

value.title: Delay Before Return
value.comment: This determines how long the block will wait before making its return movement.
value.comment2: Each value is equal to two game seconds.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the block's movement.

checkbox.title: Event Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the block will only appear if the Triggering Event ID is activated.
checkbox.comment2: Note: The block will not disappear when the event is deactivated, for as long as it remains loaded on screen. The player must place enough distance between them and the block's spawning location for it to despawn.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This determines which Event must be activated for the platform to appear.

sprite.name: Star Coin
sprite.notes: The Star Coin is a level-wide collectible. The player's goal is to collect all three to complete their savefile.

list.title: Coin Number
list.comment: This determines which Star Coin flag will be set for the level when this Star Coin is collected.
list.comment2: Multiple Star Coins with the same [Coin Number] can be placed. However, once one of them is collected, the duplicate entries will not load.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Star Coin placing it further behind other sprites.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Star Coin can only be collected if the player is on the reverse side of a Chainlink Fence.

checkbox.title: Falls when POW is Used
checkbox.comment: The Star Coin will fall to the ground if a POW effect is triggered.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Star Coin is collected, the Target Event ID will be activated.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Target Event is timed or permanent. Timed events will pause the music and replace it with ticking.

value.title: Unknown List 5
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 5 might affect something.

value.title: Unknown Value 8
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 8 might affect something.

checkbox.title: SMG Z Order
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the Z-Order of the Star Coin to Mario's pos.

sprite.name: "?" Switch (Orange)
sprite.notes: This is the basic stand-alone switch. When triggered, it modifies the Target Event.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines which Symbol is seen on the switch. This allows you to communicate different things about the expected function of the switch.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should. This is accounted for in the sprite image.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: "!" Switch (Red)
sprite.notes: This switch is similar to the ? Switch, but it has the additional effect of changing all outlined Red Blocks (Pa1_ Object 57) into solid Red Blocks. This also applies to any outlined Red Blocks spawned by a Tile God. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.

dependency.notes: Activates 'Red Block Outline A/B' tiles.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines what color the switch is. Different colored switches do not activate different colors of blocks.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should. This is accounted for in the sprite image.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Red Blocks will not become solid.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Brick Block "?" Switch (Orange)
sprite.notes: This is the basic stand-alone switch stored inside a Brick Block. When triggered, it modifies the Target Event.
sprite.advancednotes: A brick block containing or supporting a switch cannot be destroyed by sprites that destroy normal brick and solid blocks as long as the switch exists.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines which Symbol is seen on the switch. This allows you to communicate different things about the expected function of the switch.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will forcibly spawn on the underside of the block facing down, even if struck from below.
checkbox.comment2: Brick-Block switches cannot be set to fall, even if Upside-Down is unchecked.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

This also applies to any outlined Red Blocks spawned by a Tile God. This additional functionality only occurs when using the Timed Event mode, but a Target Event is not required to make use of this functionality.
sprite.advancednotes: A brick block containing or supporting a switch cannot be destroyed by sprites that destroy normal brick and solid blocks as long as the switch exists.

dependency.notes: Add Tileset / Puzzle dependency information relating to custom tileset settings.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines what color the switch is. Different colored switches do not activate different colors of blocks.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will forcibly spawn on the underside of the block facing down, even if struck from below.
checkbox.comment2: Brick-Block switches cannot be set to fall, even if Upside-Down is unchecked.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.

If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Lava Bubble (Podoboo)
sprite.notes: The Lava Bubble (Podoboo) is a firey enemey that will jump up from the lava to the height it is placed at. It can only jump a maximum of 15 blocks above the lava.

dependency.notes: The Podoboo requires [139] Lava within 15 blocks underneath it in order to appear.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Podoboo.

list.title: Splash Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the lava splash.

value.title: Delay Between Jumps
value.comment: This determines the delay between each of the Podoboo's jumps.
value.comment2: Each value is approximately 1 game second. Podoboos first load in the air at the top of their jump, so a Podoboo with a large delay value may not even interact with the player as they run by.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11 (4)
checkbox.comment: An unknown flag for Nybble 11.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 08-06 A1

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11 (2)
checkbox.comment: An unknown flag for Nybble 11.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 08-06 A1

sprite.name: Thwomp
sprite.notes: A normal sized Thwomp that will try to crush the player when it is nearby or underneath. Thwomps are not capable of destroying tileset objects unless set to Crush Forever.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Thwomp will return to its starting position or if it will continue to crush the terrain until dropping out of the level.
dualbox.comment2: If you use Crush Forever, the Thwomp must be able to fall completely through and well beyond the bottom border of the Zone, or the falling sound effect and rumble will not stop.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Thwomp.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.comment: An unknown setting for Nybble 12.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Bit 47-48 may be a list, but only value 2 has been defined. Value 3 is confirmed to CRASH the game, so do not activate this with Crush Forever. However, value 1 may provide different effects. Experimenting and testing are required.

sprite.name: Big Thwomp
sprite.notes: A larger Thwomp that will try to crush the player when it is nearby or underneath. Big Thwomps are capable of destroying certain types of tileset objects such as brick blocks and grey blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Thwomp will return to its starting position after crushing up to one row of breakable terrain, or if it will continue to crush the terrain until dropping out of the level.
dualbox.comment2: If you use Crush Forever, the Thwomp must be able to fall completely through and well beyond the bottom border of the Zone, or the falling sound effect and rumble will not stop.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Big Thwomp.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.comment: An unknown setting for Nybble 12.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Bit 47-48 may be a list, but only value 2 has been defined. Value 3 is confirmed to CRASH the game, so do not activate this with Crush Forever. However, value 1 may provide different effects. Experimenting and testing are required.

sprite.name: Fake Star Coin
sprite.notes: This coin an appearance similar to a normal Star Coin, but when the player tries to collect it, it will vanish and disperse into 4 harmless Boos like a Fake Door.

dependency.notes: A real Star Coin must be placed within the same Zone.

sprite.name: Effect - Quicksand
sprite.notes: This will draw the animated quicksand effect over a specific Location ID. The actual quicksand sinking effect is only obtained through a specific tileset object. See Dependency Notes for examples. The quicksand animation is always placed behind Layer 1 objects.

dependency.notes:
Pa1_sabaku (Desert): Object 24

Pa_sabaku_chika (Desert Cave): Object 26

Pa1_toride_sabaku (Desert Tower): Object 107

checkbox.title: Flat Top
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this removes the animated crest effect on the top portion of the quicksand. This will cause a 'square' look.
checkbox.comment2: This should be used when the quicksand connects with a ceiling or other Layer 1 terrain.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines the Location where the quicksand animation will be created.

sprite.name: Lakitu
sprite.notes: A stand-alone Lakitu, more useful for small rooms than entire levels. Lakitu will throw Spinies (or coins) at the player and will follow the player until killed.

dependency.notes: The stand-alone Lakitu will spawn at exactly the height that it is placed and will remain at that height as it follows the player. Additionally, as it does not respawn after killed unless re-entering the zone, utilizing it for its cloud riding is not recommended for mandatory progress.

dualbox.comment: This will determine which animation state is used by the Lakitu when it is first loaded.
dualbox.comment2: Spawning from the Background means that the Lakitu will fly in from the background, facing the camera.

dualbox.comment: This determines what the Lakitu will throw.
dualbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows that odd values may differ from even values. No differences observed.

checkbox.title: Low Throw Arc
checkbox.advancedcomment: When enabled, the Lakitu will throw spinies from a low throwing arc. This behavior looks glitchy when the Lakitu is moving quickly. It also should be noted this option is in a space normally used for events, so it may have a deeper function.

value.title: Unknown Value 7
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 7 might affect something.

sprite.name: Koopa Troopa
sprite.notes: Your standard Koopa Troopa. Place it in the level and it will walk towards Mario when it loads. It can either be set to walk off ledges, or turn around at ledges.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Koopa Troopa will mindlessly walk off of ledges or if it will turn around when it reaches a ledge.
dualbox.comment2: This also changes the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Load State
list.comment: This determines what animation state the Koopa Troopa will load as.
list.comment2:
Normal: The Koopa Troopa will be walking normally when loaded.

Loads as Shell: The Koopa Troopa will load inside its shell and then return to normal.

Stays in Shell: The Koopa Troopa will load inside its shell and not return to normal. However, it cannot be kicked until jumped on and will instead hurt the player.

checkbox.title: Empty Shell
checkbox.comment: When enabled, a empty kickable shell is spawned instead of a Koopa Troopa.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Chainlink Fence
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Koopa Troopa will walk behind Chainlink Fences.
checkbox.advancedcomment: Exact values are 1500.0 unchecked, -2500.0 checked.

checkbox.title: Allow the Koopa 1-Up Trick
checkbox.comment: When enabled, allows the player to perform the classic Koopa 1-Up Staircase trick.

checkbox.title: Spiky
checkbox.comment: No Comment.

sprite.name: Koopa Paratroopa
sprite.notes: Your standard Koopa Paratroopa. Place it in the level and it will jump around or fly. Once stomped, it can either be set to walk off ledges, or turn around at ledges.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines the primary type of movement behavior of the Koopa Paratroopa. Flying Paratroopas move 9 blocks total.
list.advancedcomment: Mode 3 spawns a floating shell that cannot be picked up. When Mario hits it from the side, he takes damage, but when the jumps on it, it falls to the ground and becomes a regular shell that can be picked up.

list.advancedcomment: Glitchy Behavior: The Paratroopa will bounce [] while facing the opposite direction. Once de-winged, the Koopa Troopa will walk in place while continuing to face the same direction.

list.title: Start Direction
list.comment: This determines how the Paratroopa will move upon load.

dualbox.title1: Moves in specified direction (4 blocks), then turns around
dualbox.comment: This determines how far the Flying Paratroopa will move before first turning around. The Paratroopa will always have a path of 9 Blocks, so this only sets the initial movement distance on load.

dualbox.title1: Moves in specified direction (4 blocks), then turns around
dualbox.comment: This determines how far the Flying Paratroopa will move before first turning around. The Paratroopa will always have a path of 9 Blocks, so this only sets the initial movement distance on load.
This determines if the Koopa Troopa, once stepped on and de-winged, will mindlessly walk off of ledges or if it will turn around when it reaches a ledge.
dualbox.comment2: This also changes the color of the Koopa Troopa.

list.title: Style

list.comment2: If you want the Angry Cloud to hurt players, you have to add an invisible tileset piece to do that for you. Sorry.

checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Bouncy Cloud will be bigger.

sprite.name: Event Controller - Looper (If X, do Y THEN Z+, Repeat)
sprite.notes: Similar to the Multi-Chainer, this controller will activate a sequence of Events ranging from [Target Event ID Start] through [Target Event ID End]. However, it will only activate one event at a time. After activating one event, it will deactivate it and activate the next event. Once it has done this for all events, if the [Triggering Event ID] is still activated, it will return to [Target Event ID Start] and begin again.

value.title: Target Event ID Start
value.comment: When the Triggering Event is activated, this Event ID will be activated first. It will then run until it reaches [Target Event ID End].

value.title: Target Event ID End
value.comment: After enabling and disabling this event, if the Triggering Event is still activated, the Looper will return to [Target Event ID Start] and repeat the loop.

value.title: Delay
value.comment: This determines the amount of time the Looper will wait between activating/deactivating each event.
value.comment2: A value of 6 is approximately 1 second on the game's clock.

sprite.name: Fire Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that shoots fireballs at the player.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Fire Bro.

sprite.name: Effect - Wind Physics and Sound
sprite.notes: This will generate occasional windy pushbacks and wind sound effects. It is best used in conjunction with the suggested sprites, but they are not required.

dependency.notes: In order to generate sandstorm graphics, [374] Effect - Falling Objects and Wind is required using the Snow setting. To add coins to this effect, [284] Physics Coin Controller must be linked.

list.title: Force of Wind
list.comment: This determines how strongly the wind will blow.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the wind will blow.

value.title: Time Active
value.comment: This sets the amount of time that the wind is on.

value.title: Time Inactive
value.comment: This sets the amount of time that the wind is off.

value.title: Physics ID
value.comment: This will pair the Wind Physics with Physics Coin Controller.

sprite.name: Auto-Scrolling Controller
sprite.notes:
The Auto-Scroller will lock the game's camera along a specific Path. This path cannot cause the camera to unnaturally leave the Zone's boundaries. The camera's boundary is defined by the left side of the screen, so it is recommended to leave at least one screen's width after the path's final Node.

Finally, you can alter the Speed and Acceleration of the Auto-Scroller with the Path settings in NewerSMBW.

dependency.notes: A path is required for the Auto-Scrolling Controller to function.

list.title: Activation Mode
list.comment: This determines the conditions to activate the Auto-Scroller.
list.comment2:
Event Activated: Auto-Scroller only starts when the Triggering Event is activated.

Behaves Incorrectly: Do not use this option.

Activated by Ground-Pounding [321]: When the Beta Arrow Block is ground-pounded, it sends code to the Auto-Scroller to start. Intended functionality was likely to control the direction as well.

Already Activated: Activates without the need to set a Triggering Event.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the Auto-Scroller will activate. Deactivating the event will not deactivate the Auto-Scroller; it will continue until it has reached the final Path Node.

list.title: End Behavior
list.comment: This determines what the Auto-Scroller will do with the camera when it has reached the final Node of its path.
list.comment2:
Release Control: The camera will unlock, and the player can continue wherever they want. The camera may jerk slightly when it first releases.(?)

Loop Last 2 Nodes: The Auto-Scroller will continue to scroll between the last two Nodes on the path.

Lock Screen: This option will lock the screen at the final path Node.

Unknown Value 2/3: May have different effects, ASM research is likely required.

list.title: End Behavior: Add Screen Shake
list.comment: As an additional effect to looping the last 2 nodes, you can add a rocking motion to the screen.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Auto-Scroller reaches its final path Node, this Event ID is activated.

value.title: Path ID
value.comment: This determines which Path the camera will follow while scrolling. [CLARIFY] The upper left corner of the Screen, relative to the Auto-Scroller's placement, is the starting point for the path.

value.title: Midway Start Node ID
value.comment: If the level was entered from the Midway Point, the Auto-Scroller will begin from this Node instead of the first Node in the Path.

value.title: Unknown Flag 11 (1)
value.comment: Possibly determines behavior relating to [159]
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 11 might affect something.

value.comment2: For usage examples, see Retail: 07-07 A1 Z5.

checkbox.title: Shoots Homing Missile Bills

value.title: Homing Missile Bill Limit

value.comment2: Value 0 functions the same as Value 1.

sprite.name: Hammer Bro Plus
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that throws hammers (or other objects!) at the player.

dependency.notes: The Hammer Bro will first calculate where the nearest solid ground is. This is defined as a terrain object with solid block collision. With a platform limit of one, he can jump onto any passthrough terrain or brick blocks above this solid ground at a distance of 4. With a platform limit of two, he can jump between this platform and another one above it. When on the top of this platform limit, he will not try and jump upwards. He can also jump down from passthrough terrain set higher than 8 blocks above the solid ground, though he will not be able to return.

dualbox.comment: This determines the number of Platforms the AI of the Hammer Bro tries to make use of. See Dependency Notes for more information.

sprite.notes: Assigns a spawn area where Lakitu will continue to respawn while the player is inside it. Lakitu will follow the player along the top of the camera line and toss Spiny balls at the player to hinder their progress. The sprite's vertical position is used for Lakitu's height.

sprite.name: Crowber Crow
sprite.notes: A purple crow enemy called a Crowber that will fly around in the skies above the player.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the crow's model.

sprite.name: Water
sprite.notes:
Place this in the level to generate water. There are many different ways to use this type of Water.

Underwater Zone: If you just want to create an underwater zone, check Flat Top and leave everything else blank. Then place the Water about 6 blocks above your upper Zone boundary.

Location Water: If you assign a Location ID, you can cause water to appear only within the chosen Location instead of across the entire stage.

Moving Water: You can also create water that rises and/or falls. This gets a little complicated, so be sure to read the related settings.

Water Crest's Maximum Length: The crest of Water will stop drawing past 8192 pixels (512 blocks). You can avoid this by creating multiple Locations of Water. Please note the first, left-most Location must be a multiple of 16 pixels long.

dependency.notes: When using Moving Water, the Water becomes loaded across the entire Area instead of just the active Zone. Please build your levels with this in mind. Additionally, do not use more than one Moving Water in the same Area as only the top (highest Y-Axis) one will take effect. If you need Moving Water in multiple Zones within the same area, use [253] Rising and Falling Water instead. Also, be sure to reset your Sprite Settings if you switch between different setting groups of Moving Water or Location Water to prevent unusual bugs and behavior.

list.title: Moving Water - Rising Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed at which the Water will rise, or rise and fall.

list.title: Moving Water - Falling Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed at which the Water will fall.

list.title: I really wouldn't do that if I were you...
list.comment: Right now, you've selected [Extremely Buggy]. You've made a terrible mistake somewhere and have combined the wrong settings.
list.comment2: Please don't try to set Distance or Delays while using Falling Water. You will not like the results. Please trust me.
list.advancedcomment: Oh, so you turned on Advanced, did you? You think you're so smart... Well fine, I'll share the limited documentation we have on why you shouldn't use these settings: Falling Water works in a peculiar way. When the appropriate event has not been activated, or there is no corresponding event, [Never ON] then the water surface will appear [Distance] blocks higher. The water will then sink this many blocks, respecting any delays. After waiting for the delay at the bottom, the water surface will not rise again. Not exactly. Instead, it will 'skip' the rising part and 'jump' to immediately to the top. Additionally, using this with events will cause the water to rise, instead of falling. [ON] But the starting point is the same higher distance. The difference is that the water rises continuously as long as the event is enabled. [Endless Rising] If it is disabled, [OFF after ON] the water surface will 'jump' back to where it started and remain there until the event is re-enabled. [Why bother?] Additionally, 1-5 on Movement Speed values have some additional odd glitchiness. Supposedly. So please, stop trying to combine settings like this. Or your level will suck.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Water will move.
This determines which direction the Water will move while the Triggering Event is activated.
The Water will automatically rise and fall in accordance with the set delays.

dualbox.title1: Rises Distance while On, Falls when Off
dualbox.comment: The Water will rise the Distance value once activated, and stay at the top until the Triggering Event is deactivated. If the Triggering Event is deactivated before it rises the full distance, it will finish rising, then immediately start to fall.
dualbox.comment2: This option only applies if Delay values are both set to 0, Distance is set, and Triggering ID is set. Do not use [Extremely Buggy]. No really, don't. It won't help you any.

dualbox.title1: Rising and Falling while On, Glitch-Returns when Off
dualbox.comment: The Water will rise and fall in accordance with the set delays while the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When the Triggering Event is deactivated, the Water will immediately return to its starting position in a glitchy manner. It is highly recommended to not cause this to happen in your level design. Use Event Chainers with Delays or the Event Looper to get this type of timing instead.

value.title: Moving Water - Distance
value.comment: This determines how many blocks the Water will move.
value.comment2: Setting this will drastically change the function of Moving Water. Please keep this in mind.

value.title: I wouldn't do that if I were you...
value.comment: This determines how many blocks the Water will move. Normally. But you are a bad person and are trying to set combinations of options that are known not to work. So stop right there and either change this back to zero, or select the option to the left of where it says [Extremely Buggy].

value.title: Moving Water - Delay at Top
value.comment: This determines the delay when the Water has finished rising.

value.title: Moving Water - Delay at Bottom
value.comment: This determines the delay when the Water has returned to its starting position.
value.comment2: The initial delay only can be set by using event-controlled Water. Utilize Event Chainers to fake the delay settings if you need to set an initial delay.

value.title: Moving Water - Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The Moving Water mode will be triggered when this Event is activated.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: Match with a Location ID to set a specific area in which to display Water. Note that some sprites only work correctly in Non-Location Water.
value.advancedcomment: Location Water only works properly with Location IDs 0-127. Location IDs 128-255 will cause the Water to constantly move up and down slightly. It's unknown if a use can be found for this, so it remains documented here in the Advanced Comment.

checkbox.title: Underwater Zone - Flat Top
checkbox.comment: It is suggested to enable this when creating a fully underwater zone.
checkbox.comment2: We're not too sure why this would be important, since it cannot be seen, but Nintendo will always have this checked, so you should do it too.

checkbox.title: Location Water - Flat Top
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the animated crest effect on the top portion of the Water is removed. This creates a 'square' look.
checkbox.comment2: It's recommended to only use this when the Water is touching a straight ceiling.

checkbox.title: Location Water - Place Behind Layer 0
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Z-Order of the water will be moved slightly so that it appears behind Layer 0 terrain.
checkbox.comment2: In order for this to work properly, the visibility settings for the Zone must be set to 'Normal'.

sprite.name: Lava
sprite.notes:
Place this in the level to generate lava. There are many different ways to use Lava.

Location Lava: If you assign a Location ID, you can cause lava to appear only within the chosen Location instead of across the entire stage.

Moving Lava: You can also create lava that rises and/or falls. This gets a little complicated, so be sure to read the related settings.

Lava Crest's Maximum Length: The crest of Lava will stop drawing past 8192 pixels (512 blocks). You can avoid this by creating multiple Locations of Lava. Please note the first, left-most Location must be a multiple of 16 pixels long.
