sprite.name: Floating Barrel
sprite.notes: A floating barrel that can only be placed on a liquid surface. It will sink while a player is standing on it, but will pop back up once the player jumps off. The barrel can also flow with the unused water current controller.

dependency.notes: The Floating Barrel will not load when placed on the same screen as an entrance. Place the Floating Barrel where you want it to load using the liquid line, and it will spawn floating at the surface line of that body of liquid. It only works with non-Location liquids, and it does work with Moving liquids when placed correctly. Unlike Floating Coins / ? Blocks, it will also function with Rising/Falling Water. Lastly, it should be noted that the visual splash effect is always made of water.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Floating Barrel.

checkbox.title: Initially Submerged
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the floating barrel will load partially submerged.

sprite.name: Chain Chomp
sprite.notes: A chain chomp enemy tied up to a 3 block pole. The pole must be ground-pounded 3 times to release the Chain Chomp and he will rampage in the direction he is freed destroying all block terrain in his path.
sprite.advancednotes: We're pretty sure there's no setting to change the height of the pole, but you're welcome to test a few values.

list.title: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the sprites model.

sprite.name: Porcu-Puffer
sprite.notes: A stand-alone Porcu-Puffer that will chase the player along the water line indefinitely until killed, but will not respawn.

dependency.notes: Water is required for the Porcu-Puffer to function. It must be non-location water, possibly non-moving water.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 11 might affect something.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Porcu-Puffer.

sprite.name: Message Box
sprite.notes: A block that the player can hit which will display a custom message. Messages are defined in Message.py.

dependency.notes: The Message Box Controller must be included in each Zone for Message Boxes to function correctly.

value.title: Message ID
value.comment: Messages defined in Message.py. Add 256 to the value shown in the Newer Message Editor program. (01/10/18)

sprite.name: (Unused) "?" Switch (Orange)
sprite.notes: An exact duplicate of the normal "?" Switch (Orange).

dependency.notes: The game will crash unless a normal orange switch is placed somewhere in the level. It does not have to be within an area that is actually used.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines which Symbol is seen on the switch. This allows you to communicate different things about the expected function of the switch.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should. This is accounted for in the sprite image.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Red Coin Ring
sprite.notes: A glowing red ring that is intended to be used to spawn sets of 8 red coins, and to control the item that the player will receive after collection them.

dependency.notes: The suggested use is to have 8 [144] Red Coins placed with the same Red Coin ID and Event ID as a matching Red Coin Ring. It is not recommended to use more than 1 Red Coin Ring within a single Zone, nor is it recommended to use either object for a purpose outside of the default, within a normal style level.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: When the Red Coin Ring is touched, the Target Event will be activated.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Target Event is activated temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Timed events will pause the music and replace it with ticking. It is recommended for normal Red Coin Ring use that the event be timed.

value.title: Red Coin ID
value.comment: When set, the corresponding Red Coin set will have an Item Reward. Value 0 is also a valid ID.

list.title: Item Reward
list.comment: This determines which power-up will appear after collecting 8 coins from the Red Coin ID set above. If a player already has that power-up, it will drop a 1-Up.

checkbox.title: Shift Horizontally
checkbox.comment: When this checkbox is ticked, the ring is moved half a block to the right. Note that this setting overlaps with the Red Coin ID.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 10 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 10 might affect something. No visible or functional change. Likely Z-Order related, or at least intended to be.

sprite.name: Big Pumpkin
sprite.notes: No matter what is inside, the pumpkin can easily be broken with a ground pound. It can even be broken by small Mario.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines if anything appears from inside the block when it is destroyed.

value.title: Withstands (Needs Multiple Hits)
value.comment: This determines the number of hits or ground-pounds needed for the block to break. For this function, a texture will be used that has some odd-looking white numbers on it.
value.advancedcomment: This setting may only apply to the original Giant Breakable Brick Block

sprite.name: Fire Snake
sprite.yoshinotes: While Yoshi cannot safely jump on this enemy, if he eats one he will spit out a fireball.
sprite.notes: A hopping fire enemy that will also affect the lighting in a dark Zone.

checkbox.title: Hides and Waits
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Fire Snake will be a stationary ball of fire until the player approaches it.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 11 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 11 might affect something.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the fire Snake's model.

dependency.notes: The sprite snaps to the Path Node location. From Node-0 to Node-1, it must be a straight horizontal line, and it must be at least as long as the Snake Block itself. Straight lines and exact 45° angles are recommended, as after each Node, the Snake Block will navigate in a 1-by-1 zigzag until it reaches the height of the next Node before going straight.

checkbox.title: Icy (Must Be Enabled)
checkbox.comment: This causes the Snake Block to be icy instead of green. The green version is incomplete and crashes the game, so you MUST use an icy one.

value.title: Starting Node
value.comment: This determines the Node of the Path that the Snake Block will start moving from.

list.title: End Animation
list.comment: This determines what the Snake Block will do when it reaches the final Node of the Path. Values higher than 3 cause a crash.

checkbox.title: Autostart
checkbox.comment: If this box is checked, the snake block will start moving as soon as it is loaded.

sprite.name: Magic Platform
sprite.notes: Magic Platforms are created by assigning tileset data on Layer 1 to an invisible block as a new texture, and moving that texture around. While it functions best as a moving platform, the Magic Platform does not have to move in order to perform its function. It can also simply create terrain chunks with a different type of collision than normal.

dependency.notes: It should be noted that the Magic Platform can only create rectangular shapes. It cannot have slopes, and it cannot have 'unused space' within the location. All tiles will turn into solid blocks.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines what the Magic Platform looks like. It will clone the Layer 1 tiles as it sees them within the given Location. This Location does not have to be within the current Zone boundaries.

list.title: Collision
list.comment: This determines the type of collision.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: Changes the Z-Order of the Magic Platform to place it behind Layer 2.
value.comment2: Higher values are further behind other Magic Platforms.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event is activated, the Magic Platform will move as specified. When the Event is deactivated, the Magic Platform will return to its starting position.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the Magic Platform will move.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed at which the Magic Platform will move.
value.comment2: The speed increases by a factor of .2 per increment. It must be set greater than 0 for the Magic Platform to move at all.

checkbox.title: Move Forever
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Magic Platform will move in the assigned direction while the Triggering Event is activated, and will move in the opposite direction while the Triggering Event is deactivated.

list.title: Distance
list.comment: This determines how far the Magic Platform will be moved when the Triggering Event is activated.

checkbox.title: Enable Iron Box Effect
checkbox.comment: let's do some RSMHaxxxxxxx

sprite.name: Giant Floating Log
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi can't jump off of the log, and instead rides it to the bottom. Also, he can eat the whole thing.
sprite.notes: A very large log that will slowly try to dump the player into the liquid below.

dependency.notes: While this is not dependent on liquid in order to spawn, it should be noted that it only has collision along the top. While the player is along the top two blocks of the log, the log will generate spinning momentum and try to drop the player below it. Once the player passes those top two blocks, they will instantly fall no matter how fast the log is spinning.

sprite.name: Flying "?" Block
sprite.notes: A '?' Block with wings that flies around until opened, remaining in place afterwards.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines which color the '?' Block will use.

list.title:
Color (2)
NewerGEM
list.comment: Changes the block's model.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the '?' Block will fly in.

checkbox.title: Reverse Direction
checkbox.comment: When enabled, Direction will be reversed.

list.title: Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the '?' Block will contain.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 5 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: Used in Retail: 06-05 A2. Possibly distance related.

sprite.name: Roulette Block
sprite.notes: A large roulette style block that will award either a Star, a 1-Up, a Mushroom, or a specific power-up item. It should be noted that it makes a moderate amount of noise when it's on screen.

list.title: Power-up
list.comment: This determines which power-up the block can provide.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the block's model.

sprite.name: Meteor
sprite.notes: A floating, spinning, usually safe to stand on Meteor.

value.title: Size
value.comment: This determines how large the Meteor is.
value.comment2: A setting of 0 is the same as a setting of 5. 1-255 provide general scaling from 20% to 5100% scaling.

checkbox.title: Electrified
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Meteor will be electrified, and will hurt any player that touches it.

value.title: Rotation Speed
value.comment: This determines how fast the Meteor will rotate, if at all.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Meteor will spin.

list.title: Spawn Item when Destroyed
list.comment: This determines if an item will appear when the Meteor is destroyed.
list.comment2: The Meteor can only be destroyed by the Rideable Clowncar. The Mushroom Bubbles will float in from the right of the screen after the Meteor is destroyed.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This will adjust the Z-Order of the Meteors in relation to other objects.
value.comment2: A higher value will place this sprite further towards the background.

sprite.name: Ambush - Toad Balloon
sprite.notes: Collecting 8 of these spawns a Toad House Chest. Any additional Toad Balloons are treated as the 8th Balloon. Requires an Ambush Level Controller for the balloons to spawn and function.

dependency.notes: The [454] Ambush Controller will allow the Toad Balloons to spawn. When 8 Toad Balloons have been collected, (most) enemies will be killed, and any [203] Item Chests set to spawn from Ambush Controllers will spawn.

list.title: Color
list.comment: Changes the color of the ballon and the text color when collecting.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Toad Balloon placing it further behind other sprites.

sprite.name: Midway Flag
sprite.notes: A flag that when touched by the player will mark their progress in the level and respawn them at this location when re-entering the level.
sprite.advancednotes: Only one Midway Flag works properly per level. Let's say there are five Checkpoints in a Zone. If Mario were to activate Checkpoint A through C in that order, and then die, he would respawn at Checkpoint C's Entrance, and all five Checkpoints would be activated.

list.title: Logo
list.comment: NewerSMBW changes the logo placed on the Midway Flag for each sub-world.

value.title: Entrance ID
value.comment: This determines which Entrance the level will load the player into when they respawn.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the players will face when they respawn.

sprite.name: Tile God Event
sprite.notes: The Tile God can Create / Change / Destroy tiles within a specified area when an Event is activated.

dependency.notes: The Tile God sprite can be placed no more than one block outside of the Zone it is being activated in for it to function.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the tiles affected by the Tile God's area will be created or destroyed, depending on the Mode.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the area that is affected.

value.title: Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the area that is affected.

list.title: Target Layer
list.comment: This determines which terrain layer is affected.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When creating, the Tile God will place these tiles on top of existing tiles instead of replacing them.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Tile God will act when the Triggering Event is deactivated
dualbox.comment2: When set to Reverse, previously created tiles will be destroyed, and locations where tiles were destroyed will be filled by the creation settings of the Tile God.

checkbox.title: Disable Effects
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the visual effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (332) to add your own effect in its place.

checkbox.title: Disable Sounds
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the sound effect for Tile Creation/Destruction will be removed.
checkbox.comment2: You can use the Effect/Sound Spawner (332) to add your own sound in its place.

list.title: Pattern
list.comment: This determines the fill pattern for the Tile God's selected area.
list.comment2: A checkered pattern and reverse checked pattern overlapping will create the same effect as a regular fill. This is sometimes useful for its visual effect.

list.title: Tile
list.comment: This determines what terrain tile will appear at the Tile God's selected area

value.title: Tileset Row
value.comment: When using [Tile: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15.
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

value.title: Tileset Column
value.comment: When using [Block Type: Tile from Pa(x)], you can spawn every tile from the tileset by selecting it from a grid formation. Each tileset contains 16 Rows (0-15), and 16 Columns (0-15). The first tile in the top left is 0,0 and the last tile in the bottom right is 15,15.
value.comment2:
Some common examples for Pa0:
Coin: 1,14 | Coin Outline: 1,15 | ?-Block: 3,1 | Used Block: 3,2 | Wooden Block: 3,3 | Stone Block: 3,4 | Donut Lift: 3,5 | Steel Block: 3,6

sprite.name: Urchin / Maw-Ray
sprite.notes: A small spiky ball enemy typically used in Water or a Maw-Ray. Water is not required, however, for it to load and function.

list.title: Style
list.comment: Maw-Ray acts more like [194] Mega Urchin!

value.title: Movement Distance (*2)
value.comment: This determines how far the Urchin will move, if at all. Multiply this value by 2.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Urchin will move. The starting position from their movement is in the center, not at one of the two edges.
This determines which direction the Urchin will move first. The starting position from their movement is in the center, not at one of the two edges.
This determines which direction the Urchin will move first. The starting position from their movement is in the center, not at one of the two edges.

sprite.name: Mega Urchin / Crazy Boo
sprite.notes: A large spiky ball enemy typically used in Water. Water is not required, however, for it to load and function.

value.title: Movement Distance (x2)
value.comment: This determines how far the Urchin will move, if at all. Multiply this value by 2.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Urchin will move.
This determines which direction the Urchin will move first.
This determines which direction the Urchin will move first.

sprite.name: Huckit Crab
sprite.notes: A crab enemy that will throw projectiles at the player while occasionally jumping in the air.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Huckit Crab.

list.title: Shooting Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the projectile that the Huckit Crab will huck.
list.comment2: Many values are excluded due to abnormal or glitchy behavior.

list.title: Advanced / Glitchy Shooting Options
list.comment: A full list of the Shooting Speed options including duplicates and those not suggested for use.
list.advancedcomment: Many values will cause the Huckit Crab to toss his projectile behind him. One option will also cause him to face the wrong direction, as well.

sprite.name: Giant Goomba
sprite.notes: A larger version of the Goomba that splits into two regular Goombas when stepped on.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Giant Goomba.
list.comment2: The smaller Goombas spawned correspond to it's recolor of the same value. This means that all smaller Goombas are the same color, except for Green, which is the normal brown at the smallest size.

sprite.name: Mega Goomba
sprite.notes: An even larger version of the Goomba that splits into two Giant Goombas when stepped on.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Mega Goomba.
list.comment2: The smaller Goombas spawned correspond to it's recolor of the same value. This means that all smaller Goombas are the same color, except for Green, which is the normal Brown at the smallest size.

sprite.name: Micro Goomba
sprite.notes: A very small Goomba that clings to the player until they spin jump to shake them off.

list.title: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the sprites model.

sprite.name: Chest
sprite.notes: A chest that will award some type of inventory item to the player. Note that opening a chest will complete the level with the standard exit.

dependency.notes:
NewerSMBW rewrote this sprite's settings data in a way that breaks Ambush levels. As such the following information is outdated. [432] is still required, however.

Requires ONE of these two sprites in order to not cause the game to crash. Which one depends on how the Chest is being used. If you're using it as part of an Ambush level, [454] is required. If you're using it without the Ambush arrangement, [432] is required to be placed somewhere in the level, even if it's outside of the active Zones. Additionally, if you allow the player to leave the vicinity of the Chest before it exits the player from the level, they will be able to open it again for another item, so do not allow the player to do this.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The Chest will only appear when the Triggering Event is 0 or is activated. It will not disappear if the Event is deactivated.

value.title: Number of Items Awarded
value.comment: This determines the number of different items awarded.
value.comment2:
[Bug] Item 5 mistakenly uses this value, so keep in mind this limits the possible awards.

If awarding 5 items, the 5th item must be a Star.
If awarding 6 items, the 5th item must be a Penguin Suit.
If awarding 7 items, the 5th item must be a Hammer.
You cannot award 8 items.

list.title: Item 1
list.comment: This determines what main item will appear from the Chest.

list.title: Item 2
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.

list.title: Item 3
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.

list.title: Item 4
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.

list.title: Item 5
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.
list.comment2:
[Bug] Item 5 mistakenly uses this value, so keep in mind this limits the possible awards.

If awarding 5 items, the 5th item must be a Star.
If awarding 6 items, the 5th item must be a Penguin Suit.
If awarding 7 items, the 5th item must be a Hammer.
You cannot award 8 items.

list.title: Item 6
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.
list.comment2: [Bug] Item 6 is visually a little bit glitchy, as the item awarded is shown nearby the chest.

list.title: Item 7
list.comment: This determines what other item(s) will appear from the Chest.
list.comment2: [Bug] Item 6 is visually a little bit glitchy, as the item awarded is shown behind the chest.

sprite.name: Rolling Object Spawner
sprite.notes: A spawner that will create loose Spiked Balls or Rolling Barrels. <font color="red">Only Spiked Balls work in NewerSMBW. Rolling Barrels crash the game.</font>

dualbox.comment: This determines which object the spawner will create.

value.title: Deactivation Event ID
value.comment: This Triggering Event ID will deactivate the Spiked Ball Spawner.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the spawned Spiked Ball.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed of the spawned rolling object.
list.comment2: Stopped rolling objects will still be affected by the terrain they are resting on.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines the direction in which the spawned objects will roll in relation to the spawner.

value.title: Number of Objects Spawned
value.comment: This determines how many of the rolling object will spawn.
value.comment2: If set to 0, it will continuously spawn objects.

list.title: Grouping Mode
list.comment: This determines the rate at which the objects will spawn.
list.advancedcomment: Other values need to be tested. Also try to find out if there's a difference between values 3 and 4.
list.entry: Spawn three items, then long pause
Spawn three items, then short pause
Spawn one item, then long pause
Spawn one item, then long pause

sprite.name: Water Ball
sprite.notes: A floating ball of water that can move around and synchronize its movement with Coins.

dependency.notes: Water Balls require that [317] Enables Bubbles be placed in every Zone containing a Water Ball.

value.title: Water Ball ID
value.comment: This pairs matching 'Water Ball' controlled objects to this controller.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size and shape of the Water Ball.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Water Ball will drift.
This determines which initial direction the Water Ball will drift.
This determines which initial direction the Water Ball will drift.

value.title: Distance Moved
value.comment: This determines the distance the Water Ball will drift in one direction before returning.

sprite.name: Zoom Controller
sprite.notes:
A controller that creates an 'area' where the zoom of the camera changes when a player enters it.

For reference, the normal zoom levels, selected under 'Zone Settings', have the following screen sizes (HeightxWidth):
Zoom Level -2: 7x12.5 blocks
Zoom Level -1: 10.5x18.75 blocks
Zoom Level 0: 14x24.75 blocks
Zoom Level 1: 17x30.25 blocks, or 16x28.5 blocks
Zoom Level 2: 20x35.56 blocks, or 19x33.75 blocks
Zoom Level 3: 24x42.67 blocks, or 20x35.5 blocks
Zoom Level 4: 28x49.75 blocks

value.title: Affected Height
value.comment: This determines the height of the affected area.

value.title: Affected Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the affected area.

list.title: Screen's Zoomed Height
list.comment: This determines what the new screen height will be while a player is within the controller's area.
list.comment2:
*: The height is determined by the normal Zoom Level; the value within the brackets will be used if Zone Bias is enabled.

**: When a player enters the affected area, the height will 'immediately be set to 10 blocks shorter than the final height and then grows to the correct size, and when the players leave the affected area this process is reversed.'

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 5 (8)
checkbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 5 may affect something else.

list.title: Unknown Value 6
list.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 6 may affect something.

sprite.name: ? Block
sprite.notes: Your most basic, most flexible, standard Question Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn enough for every player! Such a generous block~

dependency.notes: If pairing the ?-Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2: Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown. Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

dualbox.comment: This determines which item table will the ? block use.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-order of the ?-Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the ?-Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.

checkbox.title: Follows Lines
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the ?-Block will attempt to follow Lines.
checkbox.advancedcomment: It is recommended to use [402] Line Controlled ? Block instead.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the ?-Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.
dualbox.advancedcomment: It is recommended to use [402] Line Controlled ? Block instead.

sprite.name: (Unused) ? Block
sprite.notes: This is a nearly identical version of [207] to the point that you should probably just be using [207]...

dependency.notes: If pairing the ?-Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the ?-Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the ?-Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the ?-Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.
checkbox.advancedcomment: When this is checked, enemies will fall through the block from all sides, even from above. This is also the case for the block's final form (Used Block). The player cannot pass through the block.

sprite.name: Brick Block
sprite.notes: Your most basic, most flexible, standard brown Brick Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn only one, no matter how many players! Such a stingy block~

dependency.notes: If pairing the Brick Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Brick Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release only one power-up item.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Brick Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the Brick Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.
checkbox.advancedcomment: When this is checked, enemies will fall through the block from all sides, even from above. This is also the case for the block's final form (Used Block). The player cannot pass through the block.

checkbox.title: Follows Lines
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Brick Block will attempt to follow Lines.
checkbox.advancedcomment: It is recommended to use [402] Line Controlled ? Block instead.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Brick Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.
dualbox.advancedcomment: It is recommended to use [403] Line Controlled Brick Block instead.

sprite.name: Rolling Hill
sprite.notes: A rotating circle that has the same general appearance as various tilesets.

dependency.notes: The underside of a Rolling Hill does NOT have collision. Do not place a Rolling Hill in any situation where the player would have contact with the bottom 50% of the hill.

list.title: Style / Size
list.comment: This determines the style and size of the Rolling Hill.

value.title: Custom Size
value.comment: This determines the size of the Rolling Hill when using Flexible Size

list.title: Custom Style A
list.comment: This determines the tiling used on the Rolling Hill.
list.comment2: If nothing is selected, your game will crash. Please choose a value from the list or change [Style /Size].

list.title: Custom Style B
list.comment: This determines the tiling used on the Rolling Hill.
list.comment2: If nothing is selected, your game will crash. Please choose a value from the list or change [Style /Size].

value.title: Set me to 0 or the game will CRASH
value.comment: [64 Blocks (Underground)] is not compatible with Custom Size/Style and will cause your game to crash if this is not set to 0.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines how quickly the Rolling Hill makes a full rotation.
value.comment2: A higher value will create a faster Rolling Hill. Large rolling hills with high speed settings will rotate VERY fast.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Rolling Hill rolls.

value.title: Z-Order
value.comment: This determines the relative Z-Order placement of the Rolling Hill when compared to other Rolling Hills.
value.comment2: If you have multiple Rolling Hills overlapping each other, you must use this setting to prevent graphical glitches. Rolling Hills with a higher Z-Order number will show behind those with a lower number.

value.title: Hill ID
value.comment: This pairs matching Rolling Hill Coins to this hill.

sprite.name: Captain Bowser
sprite.notes: NewerSMBW's Final Boss fight features Bowser riding a small airship while lobbing junk at the players.

dependency.notes: Captain Bowser requires a lot of stuff hidden off in a corner of the level in order to function properly and without crashes. Beyond those, you will need a Clowncar with Cannon to damage him.

sprite.name: Poisoned Water
sprite.notes:
Place this in the level to generate poisonous water. There are many different ways to use Poisoned Water.

Location Poisoned Water: If you assign a Location ID, you can cause poisonous water to appear only within the chosen Location instead of across the entire stage.

Moving Poisoned Water: You can also create posionous water that rises and/or falls. This gets a little complicated, so be sure to read the related settings.

Poison Water Crest's Maximum Length: The crest of Poison Water will stop drawing past 8192 pixels (512 blocks). You can avoid this by creating multiple Locations of Poison Water. Please note the first, left-most Location must be a multiple of 16 pixels long.
