sprite.name: Stretching Line Block
sprite.notes: A platform made up of orange or other-colored blocks that shrinks and expands while moving up and down.

dependency.notes: This platform can be paired with [312] Stretching Line Block Controller in order to synchronize movement across multiple platforms.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Stretching Line Block.

value.title: Width - Top
value.comment: This determines the width of the platform when it is in its top position.

value.title: Width - Bottom
value.comment: This determines the width of the platform when it is in its bottom position.

dualbox.comment: This determines the initial direction the platform will move.

value.title: Stretch ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching controller for movement sycnronization.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: This determines the distance between the top and bottom states of the platform.
value.comment2: The speed is constant and not based on how large the distance is, so larger distances will take longer to travel. Additionally, because the change in the number of blocks is accomplished in the same time period of time that it takes the Stretching Line Block to travel up or down, if the movement distance is 0 then the platform will grow or shrink immediately.

sprite.name: Invisible Block
sprite.notes: Your most sneaky, most annoying, hidden transparent Invisible Block. When spawning power-ups, it will spawn only one, no matter how many players! Such a rude block~
sprite.advancednotes: The tileset-based Invisible Blocks can be destroyed by sprites like Bob-ombs. Sprite-based Invisible Blocks however cannot be destroyed.

dependency.notes: If pairing the Invisible Block for movement or other features, you'll likely need one of the sprites listed in the Dependency List.

list.title: Movement Type
list.comment: This determines which type of movement the Block will be assigned.
list.comment2:
Movement Types 2, and 9+ are unused or otherwise unknown.
Movement Type 3 and Type 8 only function with Coins. If you want to experiment with unknown Types, you'll need to modify the Raw Data.

value.title: Path Movement ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with Sprite 159, match the Path Movement ID to enable Path controlled movement.

value.title: Two Way Line ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 260, match the Two Way Line ID to enable Two Way synchronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Set to Zero
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 474, no further action is needed to create Dancing syncronized movement.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 172, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform with the Bolt.

value.title: Mushroom ID
value.comment: If pairing the Invisible Block with sprite 382, match the Mushroom ID to enable Mushroom Bolt controlled movement. It will be paired to the platform without the Bolt.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will only release one power-up item.

checkbox.title: Place Behind Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the Invisible Block placing it further behind other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: This will place the Invisible Block behind even Chainlink Fence and Layer 1 terrain.

checkbox.title: Follows Lines
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Invisible Block will attempt to follow Lines.
checkbox.advancedcomment: It is recommended to use [402] Line Controlled ? Block instead.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Invisible Block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.
dualbox.advancedcomment: If this doesn't work, nothing will!

sprite.name: Checkered Spring Block
sprite.notes: A block with a spring-like effect that allows the player to jump on it and bounce off of it in order to jump higher.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spring Block.

list.title: Alternate Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Spring Block when the Alternate Color Pattern is enabled.

checkbox.title: Alternate Color Pattern
checkbox.comment: When enabled, it will use the alternate color.
checkbox.comment2: Using an Inverted Checkers variant allows you to string together a line of Spring Blocks and have them look nice.

sprite.name: Jumbo Ray
sprite.notes: A large manta ray enemy that the player can stand on. It cannot hurt the player and instead functions similarly to a platform.

dependency.notes: In order for the Jumbo Ray to respawn, you must include a Jumbo Ray Respawner. This sprite's vertical placement is irrelevant - the Jumbo Ray will always spawn from the bottom of the Zone. The sprite still needs to be placed within the Zone, however. For cleanliness sake, you should make the Zone a bit taller and use a Scroll Limiter pair along the bottom in order to hide the lower part of the zone.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Jumbo Rays.

value.title: Initial Delay?
value.comment: Definitely not measured in Mario seconds.

dualbox.comment: This determines the direction the Jumbo Ray will travel across the screen.

value.title: Altitude (Flight Route)
value.comment: This determines how high the Jumbo Ray will fly up from the bottom of the screen.
value.comment2: More research is required on the exact details of each number, but Retail levels use 1 and 2 with 2 being higher, while Newer also uses 0 which also seems to be fairly high.

value.title: Ray ID
value.comment: This determines which Jumbo Ray Respawner will influence the respawn of this Jumbo Ray.

sprite.name: Sand/Water/Ice Pillar
sprite.notes: A pillar that pushes the player upwards and can be stood on.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the model and effects of the pillar.

sprite.name: Bramball
sprite.notes: A long-legged enemy with a ball for a body that will flip itself around as it traverses terrain with proper spacing. Rumor has it that if it is struck from below with a Pipe Cannon, a large amount of coins will appear. Kaching!

dependency.notes: For a Bramball to want to move, he must have solid terrain exactly 4 blocks from his legs.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the Bramball.

dualbox.comment: This determines how quickly the Bramball will traverse platforms.
This determines which direction the Bramball will attempt to move first.

sprite.name: Wiggling Mushroom Platform
sprite.notes: A mushroom platform that can tilt back and forth.

dependency.notes: Wiggling Mushroom Platforms may be paired with [313] Wiggling Mushroom Controller to enable synchronized movement across a Zone.

value.title: Wiggling Mushroom ID
value.comment: This pairs the platform to a matching Wiggling Mushroom Controller for synchronized movement.
value.comment2: If an ID is set, that ID will control and override all matching Wiggle Speeds.

value.title: Wiggle Speed
value.comment: This determines how quickly the platform will tilt from one side to the other.
value.comment2: If set to 0 the platform will not wiggle at all, but can still have Upwards Lift.

value.title: Tilt Distance
value.comment: This determines how much the platform will tilt.
value.comment2: A value of 1 or 2 is recommended.

dualbox.comment: This determines the initial direction the platform will tilt in.

value.title: Upwards Lift
value.comment: This determines how much vertical movement is mixed into the tilting motion.
value.comment2: May have combination restrictions.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Mushroom Platform.

list.title: Width of Platform
list.comment: This determines the width of the mushroom platform.

list.title: Length of Stem
list.comment: This determines the length of the decorative mushroom stem.

sprite.name: Effect - Cloud Area
sprite.notes: This adds decorative patchs of cloud cover with different properties. Most modes required a Location ID, but some do not.

list.title: Cloud Type
list.comment: This determines which type of cloud will be spawned. See the extra comment for details.
list.comment2:
Normal: A light patch of clouds spawns in the Location ID. It is denser than [446].
Dense: A dense patch of clouds spawns in the Location ID.
Death Clouds: - A dense patch of purple clouds that will instantly kill the player spawns in the Location ID. They can be cleared away with spin jumps.
Drifting Death Clouds: A dense patch of purple clouds that spawns around a specific Location ID, that proceeds to drifts to the right across the entire stage. It cannot be cleared away with a spin jump like other Death Clouds, and it will generate a rumbling sound effect when the player is close to it. (A Location ID may not actually be required.)
Falling Clouds: Clouds fall in the background across the entire stage.
list.advancedcomment:
1, 3: Used by Foo and cannot be placed.
6, 9-15: No clouds spawn.

value.title: Location ID
value.comment: This determines the location in which the cloud effect will appear.

checkbox.title: Airship Clouds
checkbox.comment: Airship clouds only work for cloud types 0, 4 and 7, and they will span the entire zone regardless of the location's width (they will be at the location's height though).

sprite.name: Line God Event
sprite.notes: The Line God can hide and unhide Line Guides within a specified area by using Events.

dependency.notes: The Line God cannot create new Line objects, only determine if the object within its affected area are displayed and functional.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the Line Guides affected by the Line God's area will be hidden or unhidden, depending on the Mode.

value.title: Width
value.comment: Width of the area affected by the Line God.

value.title: Height
value.comment: Height of the area affected by the Line God.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Line God will act when the Triggering Event is activated.
dualbox.comment2: When the event is not active, the Line Guides will exist in the opposite state from what's listed.

sprite.name: Newer Cutscene Controller: Credits
sprite.notes: <font color="red">This sprite is predominately hardcoded in how it functions. Custom usage is not recommended.</font>
sprite.advancednotes: It needs a very specific level set-up to function. Shows the Bowser ctscene that runs in a separate level.

sprite.name: Special Event
sprite.notes: This sprite can do all sorts of special functions, such as freezing actors, changing the size of sprites, editing the game Timer, and changing the gravity. This function is restricted to the active Zone. The settings available to each type will appear when selecting that option. Be sure to reset the Sprite Settings when switching between different types in order to prevent any bugs.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: The Special Event is on as long as this Event is activated.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines the effect of the Special Event.
list.comment2:
Time Stop: Freezes some Actors/Elements.
Pause Timer: Pauses the Level's Clock, different from Time Stop.
Set Timer: Changes the time on the Level's Clock.
Change Gravity: Changes player physics to simulate a different type of gravity.
Resizer: Changes the size of all sprites affected by this function.
Selective Resizer: Changes the size of sprites affected by this function to their specified sizes.
Background Resizer: Changes the Background settings.
Disable Z-Order Fixes: Deactivates all Z-Order modifications while the Special Event is activated.
Disable MP Bubbling: Deactivates the ability to 'bubble' yourself during Multiplayer.

checkbox.title: Time Stop: Platforms <font color="red">(Disabled)</font>
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Special Event will freeze all Platforms that support this function.

checkbox.title: Time Stop: Players <font color="red">(Disabled)</font>
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Special Event will freeze all Players.
checkbox.comment2: Remember to deactivate the Special Event or else Mario and the other Players will remain frozen. Forever~

checkbox.title: Time Stop: Terrain <font color="red">(Disabled)</font>
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Special Event will freeze all Terrain Animations.

checkbox.title: Time Stop: Enemies <font color="red">(Disabled)</font>
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Special Event will freeze all Enemies that support this function.

list.title: Gravity Type
list.comment: This determines what the altered state of gravity will be while the Special Event is activated.
list.comment2: Anti Gravity is a little strange, not fully documented, and defnitely not recommended for normal use.

value.title: Set Time to...
value.comment: This determines what the Level's Clock will be set to when the Special Event is activated.
value.comment2: Do not use a value higher than 999.

list.title: Scale / Size (Global)
list.comment: The Special Event will resize all Enemies in the Zone that support this function.

list.title: Scale / Size (Selective)
list.comment: The Special Event will resize all Enemies in the Zone according to this individual setting found in each sprite, even if that data is also controlling another function. Be sure to enable the level setting in Reggie to display Size Hacks for Data A or B.

list.title: bgA (Scenery) X Size
list.comment: The Special Event will resize the 'Scenery' background picture horizontally. Higher Values = Bigger Size

list.title: bgA (Scenery) Y Size
list.comment: The Special Event will resize the 'Scenery' background picture vertically. Higher Values = Bigger Size

list.title: bgB (Backdrop) X Size
list.comment: The Special Event will resize the 'Backdrop' background picture horizontally. Higher Values = Bigger Size

list.title: bgB (Backdrop) Y Size
list.comment: The Special Event will resize the 'Backdrop' background picture vertically. Higher Values = Bigger Size

sprite.name: Infinite Question Block
sprite.notes: Question Block that never became used.

list.title: Content
list.notes: Content of the Infinite Question Block

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled ? Block
sprite.notes: A ?-Block that can either be moved by rotation controllers or manually angled.

dependency.notes: A rotation controller is not required for this sprite to function. You can, instead, set a manual angle for the block.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the ?-Block to a matching rotation controller.

list.title: Tilt Angle
list.comment: This determines the angle the block will be tilted.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will be tilted.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players. Some items, such as the Spring, won't appear if the player strikes the Block while it is actively rotating.

sprite.name: Rotation Controlled Brick Block
sprite.notes: A Brick Block that can either be moved by rotation controllers or manually angled.

dependency.notes: A rotation controller is not required for this sprite to function. You can, instead, set a manual angle for the block.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the ?-Block to a matching rotation controller.

list.title: Tilt Angle
list.comment: This determines the angle the block will be tilted.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will be tilted.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will only release one power-up item. Some items, such as the Spring, won't appear if the player strikes the Block while it is actively rotating.

sprite.name: D-Pad Door
sprite.notes: A standard door with a D-Pad symbol on it that can have an Entrance placed on it.
sprite.advancednotes: The door can also be paired with a Rotation Controller, but the results are moderately glitchy with many combinations not functioning and several restrictions on getting them to work as actual doors.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: This determines which direction the door will be facing.
list.comment2: A door can only be entered if it is upright.
list.advancedcomment: As decoration, this is fine. Actually making it properly associate its corresponding Entrance is either impossible or very functionally strange.

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the door will only function when paired with a Rotation ID.
checkbox.advancedcomment: 'Function' is perhaps misleading. There are only a few ways you can successfully utilize a Rotation Controller door. For starters, you can only enter the door while it is almost fully upright. There is also a peculiarity with how the Entrance is placed. The most reliable way to use a Rotation Controlled Door is to place it with an already activated Spinning controller that returns to its original position when deactivated.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Door to a matching rotation controller.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the door's model.

sprite.name: Lily Piranha Plant
sprite.notes: A floating piranha plant that balances a spiky spore ball in the air above it.

dependency.notes: The piranha plant must be placed inside or on the surface of water [138] to spawn. It will snap to the surface when loaded on-screen.

checkbox.title: Disable Collisions After Death
checkbox.comment: When Lily Piranhas die and sink, they bounce when they hit a solid tile, such as a wall. This flag disables that behavior.

list.title: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the sprites model.

sprite.name: Stalking Piranha Plant
sprite.notes: A walking piranha plant that will extend and harass the player, then shrink and wander around for a bit.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the piranha plant will attempt to move first after shrinking.

value.title: Movement Distance
value.comment: This determines how far the piranha plant will wander in both directions from its starting point.

checkbox.title: Slower in Water
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the piranha plant will walk more slowly when moving through water.

checkbox.title: Increase Z-pos by 200
checkbox.comment: When ticked, the piranha plant's z position will be 200 higher.

list.title: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the sprites model.

sprite.name: Lava Geyser
sprite.notes: An eruption of lava that will block a player's path.

dependency.notes: While it is not required, it is recommended to place the geyser partially submerged in Lava of some form.

list.title: Geyser Height
list.comment: This determines how high the geyser will erupt.

dualbox.comment: This determines the state of the geyser when it first loads on the screen.

list.title: Eruption Length
list.comment: This determines how long the geyser will erupt.

list.title: Delay Between Eruptions
list.comment: This determines how long the geyser will wait between eruptions.

list.title: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the sprites model.

sprite.name: Parachute Bob-Omb
sprite.notes: A parachuting Bob-Omb enemy that will turn into a standard Bob-Omb after it lands.

dependency.notes: The Y-position of the Bob-Omb has no effect. It will always appear directly above the top edge of the screen.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Bob-Omb.

sprite.name: Ice Bro
sprite.notes: A standard Brothers enemy that shoots ice balls at the player.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: This determines the color of the Ice Bro.

sprite.name: Ghost House Door
sprite.notes: A Ghost House door that can have an Entrance placed on it.
sprite.advancednotes: The door can also be paired with a Rotation Controller, but the results are moderately glitchy with many combinations not functioning and several restrictions on getting them to work as actual doors.

checkbox.title: Fake Door
checkbox.comment: When enabled, when the player attempt to enter the door, it will vanish and disperse into 4 harmless Boos.

list.title: Orientation
list.comment: This determines which direction the door will be facing.
list.comment2: A door can only be entered if it is upright.
list.advancedcomment: As decoration, this is fine. Actually making it properly associate its corresponding Entrance is either impossible or very functionally strange.

checkbox.title: Rotation Controlled (Buggy)
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the door will only function when paired with a Rotation ID.
checkbox.advancedcomment: 'Function' is perhaps misleading. There are only a few ways you can successfully utilize a Rotation Controller door. For starters, you can only enter the door while it is almost fully upright. There is also a peculiarity with how the Entrance is placed. The most reliable way to use a Rotation Controlled Door is to place it with an already activated Spinning controller that returns to its original position when deactivated.

value.title: Rotation ID
value.comment: This pairs the Door to a matching rotation controller.

sprite.name: World-3 Boss: Balboa Wrench
sprite.notes: The giant Rocky Wrench boss used by NewerSMBW. He must be Ground-Pounded 3 times to be defeated.

dependency.notes: Kamek and Kamek Controller can be placed in any area. They should be placed in an area on their own, though.

dualbox.comment: Affects certain cinematics.

sprite.name: Giant Ice Block
sprite.notes: A large 3x3 ice block that can be broken with an explosion.

list.title: Frozen Inside
list.comment: This determines what type of object is frozen inside the block.
list.comment2: Bob-Omb ice blocks will explode to other nearby ice blocks.

sprite.name: Angry Sun and Moon
sprite.notes: A recreation of the Angry Sun enemy from Super Mario Bros. 3 that will chase the player indefinitely unless the Triggering Event is activated.

dualbox.comment: This determines which model the enemy will use.

value.title: Die on Triggering Event ID
value.comment: Disappears, when this Event ID is activated.

checkbox.title: Never Respawns
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the enemy will not respawn after being defeated or after leaving the screen.
checkbox.comment2: If this is not enabled, the enemy will continue to respawn once loaded until the Triggering Event is activated. One way to manage this with locations is to use an IF controller that deactivates the Triggering Event while a player is inside the specified location.

sprite.name: World-1 Boss: Fuzzy Bear
sprite.notes: The giant Fuzzy boss that jumps around and occasionally rolls after the player. It can only be defeated by having grabbable items thrown at it.

dependency.notes: Kamek and his controller should be included in the Area.

dualbox.comment: Affects certain cinematics.

sprite.name: Rotating Wooden Airship Wheel
sprite.notes: A circular wheel matching the standard airship decor that rotates, making it hard to stand on.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the wheel.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color and style of the wheel.
list.advancedcomment: More colors and styles can be added for your hack.

dualbox.comment: This determines the direction the wheel will rotate in.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines the speed of the wheel's rotation. A speed of 0 still moves, just very slowly.

sprite.name: Rolling Barrel
sprite.notes: A barrel that will roll across the terrain breaking certain types of terrain and blocks.

list.title: Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Rolling Barrel.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the barrel will roll.

sprite.name: Wooden and Metal Boxes
sprite.notes: Wooden boxes can be opened if Ground-Pounded, struck from below, etc. and can award the player with an item. Metal boxes can instantly kill the player, cannot be destroyed, and make a POW sound when falling. They also have odd issues when it comes to respawning if they have moved from their original location.

dualbox.comment: This determines the type of box.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the box.

list.title: Wooden Box Contains
list.comment: This determines what the Wooden Box contains.
list.comment2: Unlisted values contain Mushrooms.

value.title: Unknown Value 5
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 5 might affect something.

sprite.name: World-6 Boss: Ramboo
sprite.notes: The extra large Boo boss that is not the least bit shy about continuing to advance towards the player. He can be knocked back with grabbable items and can only be defeated when the specified Event is activated.

value.title: Die on Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When activated, the Ramboo will be killed, completing the level.

dualbox.comment: Affects certain cinematics.

sprite.name: Para-Beetle
sprite.notes: A small flying Buzzy Beetle type enemy that can be ridden on top of, but will still hurt the player if they contact one from the side or from below.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Para-Beetle.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines how fast the Para-Beetle flies. Value 0 keeps it in place.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines what direction the Para-Beetle flies.

list.title: Facing
list.comment: This determines what direction the Para-Beetle is facing.

sprite.name: Heavy Para-Beetle
sprite.notes: A large flying Buzzy Beetle type enemy that can be ridden on top of, but will still hurt the player if they contact one from the side or from below.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Para-Beetle.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines how fast the Para-Beetle flies.

sprite.name: Giant Buzzy Beetle
sprite.notes: A very large Buzzy Beetle that isn't especially pretty, but will carry the player around on its back. It can still hurt the player from the side.
sprite.advancednotes: Giant Buzz Beetles don't fall down if placed in the air. They will follow the ground and slopes, if snapped to the ground. Finally, they will move in a straight line if they reach a 90° drop.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Giant Buzzy Beetle.
list.advancedcomment: More colors and styles can be added for your hack.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines how quickly the Buzzy Beetle will move.
value.comment2: When the speed value is set to 15, the Buzzy Beetle will sometimes not load. When the speed is 0, the Beetle won't move.

list.comment2: "At You" - Looking at the camera while walking to the left. The perspective does not change the Direction the beetle walks. No movement at 0 (looks strange).

sprite.name: Dragon Coaster
sprite.notes: A quick Line guided platform that will screech and clatter as it travels.

list.title: Length
list.comment: This determines how many platform segments make up the Dragon Coaster.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Dragon Coaster. The current colors both either show no difference, or crash the game.

value.title: Speed
value.comment: This determines how quickly the Dragon Coaster will travel along the Lines.

checkbox.title: Touch Activated
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this platform will activate when all players are touching the Dragon Coaster.
checkbox.comment2: When not enabled, this platform will only activate when a platform with the same Dragon ID is activated through Touch Activation.

value.title: Dragon ID
value.comment: This will pair multiple Dragon Coasters together so that when one of them starts, they all start at the same time.
value.comment2: Do not pair more than one Dragon Coaster with [Touch Activated] enabled!

list.title: Camera Influenced Trajectory
list.comment: This determines if the cannonball will be influenced by the camera's actions, such as when using [399] Airship Rocking.

dualbox.comment: This determines the size of the cannon and cannonball.
This determines which direction the cannon will face.

list.title: Normal Cannon Length
list.comment: This determines how long the cannon is.

list.title: Giant Cannon Length
list.comment: This determines how long the cannon is. If the cannon is giant, the collision will always be value + 3 blocks long, but the visual will not.

checkbox.title: Direction Override: Down, Causes Weird Bugs
checkbox.advancedcomment: Only the front of the cannon will be changed, and when also set to face left, causes weird influence on the cannonball's trajectory. Highly suggested to not use this setting.

sprite.name: Monty Mole
sprite.notes: An energetic mole enemy that will pop out of the terrain after loading on screen and proceed to move quickly after the player. A Monty Hole is left behind after the mole jumps out.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Monty Mole.

checkbox.title: Loose Monty Mole
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Monty Mole will already be out of the wall running around, and does not leave behind a Monty Hole.

sprite.name: Platform Hammer Bro
sprite.notes: 'En_Lift_HammerBros' - Likely allows it to be used on places where he shouldn't jump off.

dualbox.comment: This determines the number of Platforms the AI of the Hammer Bro tries to make use of. See Dependency Notes for more information.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Hammer Bro.

list.title: Thrown Object
list.comment: This determines which object will be thrown by the Hammer Bro Plus.

sprite.name: Mega Icicle
sprite.notes: A large hanging icicle that can fall if the player comes too close to it. It can also be triggered by a Snake Block.

sprites.sprite:
Icicle (Original) Crystal
* No (Straight) Yes (Tilts Right? Towards Player/Source?)
Dies, with Tilting Drop Dies, with Upright Drop Lives, Falls Straight Down

sprite.name: Falling Chestnut
sprite.notes: A hanging Chestnut that can quickly falls upon the player's approach with various potential effects.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the Chestnut.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the Chestnut.
list.comment2: Large values will very likely look ugly alongside other level content.

list.title: Chestnut Contains
list.comment: This determines what object is inside of the Chestnut.

checkbox.title: Falls Earlier
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Chestnut will fall if the player is 3 blocks from the sprite placement, instead of directly under it.

checkbox.title: Falls only from POW
checkbox.comment: When enabled, instead of falling from the approach of a player, the Chestnut will only fall if a POW is used.

checkbox.title: Breaks Blocks
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Chestnut will destroy certain types of blocks and tileset pieces.

list.title: Star Coin Number
list.comment: This determines which Star Coin will be credited by the coin inside the Chestnut.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 4 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: Not used in Newer, function unclear. Wha??

sprite.name: World-2 Boss: Mega Thwomp
sprite.notes: A large Thwomp boss used by NewerSMBW. It can be defeated by having it fall through crushable terrain at least 4 blocks wide.

dependency.notes: The Mega Thwomp should be placed at ground level on the opposite end of the room from the player's entrance. Also, Kamek and his controller must be included in the Area.

value.title: Left Buffer
value.comment: This defines the empty space the Mega Thwomp will be allowed to move through from the left side of the sprite's placement, calculated in half-blocks.

value.title: Right Buffer
value.comment: This defines the empty space the Mega Thwomp will be allowed to move through from the right side of the sprite's placement, calculated in half-blocks.

value.title: Top Buffer
value.comment: This defines the empty space the Mega Thwomp will be allowed to move upwards from the sprite's placement, calculated in half-blocks.

sprite.name: World-5 Boss: Podouble
sprite.notes: A pair of large Podoboo bosses used in NewerSMBW. It can only be defeated by using fire or ice attacks against the correct half, and spawns a Yoshi for each player to assist them.

dependency.notes: Both an Ice Podouble and a Fire Podouble are required for this boss fight. The Podouble grows 300% in an upwards direction from the base of the sprite. They can only be damaged by the opposite elemental attack, and a Yoshi is provided automatically to help with this.

dualbox.comment: This determines which half of the Podouble duo the sprite is.
dualbox.comment2: Fire will always face right, and Ice will always face left.

value.title: Falling Offset
value.comment: This determines the bottom of the Podouble's jump relative to the sprite's placement, calculated in half-blocks.

sprite.name: Sound/Graphic Effects Spawner
sprite.notes:
Enables event-driven spawning of Sound Effects and Graphic Effects.
Limitations
1) Do not use 1000 or more sounds/effects per area.
2) A single Event ID can only trigger one sound/effect per area
3) Only a specific number of sounds/effects can be active at the same time
4) Only two BRSTMs can be active at the same time.
sprite.advancednotes: If spawning a Sound Efect, the placement of the sprite is crucial, as the sound is emitted from that position. If the player is ~3 screens away from the sprite, then they won't hear it anymore. Placing multiple sprites with the same settings at different locations is possible.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this Event ID is activated, the associated sound or affect will be played.

external.title: Sfx ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Sound Effect.

external.title: Gfx ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Graphic Effect.

dualbox.comment: This determines if you are spawning a sound effect or a graphical effect. The list of graphical effects is limited to the entries used by Newer. NewerGem does not have this limitation and uses all available 1004 Gfx.
dualbox.comment2: The volume of the sound effect is relative to the distance of the placement of the spawner.

list.title: Effect Scale
list.comment: This determines the size of the spawned graphic effect.

value.title: Loop Delay
value.comment: This determines the number of seconds between activations of the sound or graphic effect.
value.comment2: The effect will only activate once if the delay is left at 0.

sprite.name: Giant Koopa Shell Cave
sprite.notes: A decorative large shell that can be used as a cave with the right arrangement of invisible blocks and settings.

dependency.notes: Look in Retail 5-01 A1 for an example of how to use this sprite correctly. You will need to make use of Spotlight Lighting, Layer 0 tiles, and invisible collision blocks in order for it to look correct.

dualbox.comment: This determines the color of the Shell Cave.

checkbox.title: Remove Grass/Rocks
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this will remove the decoration from the bottom of the Shell Cave.

sprite.name: Fireball Laser
sprite.notes: A controller that creates a constant stream of fireballs in a specific direction. These fireballs will not pass through terrain. They spawn at the top left corner of the sprite's placement.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: While this Event ID is activated, the controller will create fireballs.

list.title: Direction
list.comment: This determines which direction the fireballs will fire in.

sprite.name: Yoshi Fruit
sprite.notes: An edible fruit that Yoshi can grab. Collecting five will cause Yoshi to lay an egg. What's inside the egg will change depending on the player's current power-up. Normal -> Fire -> Ice -> Propeller -> 1-Up.

list.title: Type
list.comment: This determines if the fruit is a standard berry, or if it is a special fruit that will instantly award a power-up egg.

sprite.name: Effect - Rising (Lava) Particle
sprite.notes: An effects controller that creates small particles that rise from the bottom of the screen. The density of the effect is increased for every instance of the sprite placed in the zone. It can be used alongside other effects.

list.title: Particle Frequency
list.comment: This determines the frequency of the particle effect.

list.title: Particle Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the particle effect.

sprite.name: Lighting - Fire Lamp
sprite.notes: A decorative fire lamp that generates light around it. It has no collision by default.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the fire lamp.

sprite.name: Cooligan
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi cannot jump on Cooligans, though he can use the stomp attack and tongue attack to defeat them.

sprite.name: Lakitu Cloud Block
sprite.notes: A block that when struck from below will spawn a Lakitu enemy that throws coins instead of Spinies.

value.title: Maximum Coins Thrown (*5)
value.comment: This determines how many coins the Lakitu will throw before flying off.
value.comment2: A value of 1 is equal to 5 coins across 15 game seconds. If set to 0, the Lakitu will never fly off.

value.title: Spawn Height
value.comment: This determines the distance relative to the bottom border of the Zone, in which the Lakitu will float upwards before it begins to throw coins.
value.comment2: At value 0, the top of the Lakitu's shell will reach 12 blocks above the bottom Zone border. Each additional value increases this by two blocks. A value of 4 is equal to the standard height of a [134] Lakitu Spawn Area's Lakitu spawn.

sprite.name: Effect - Falling Objects and Wind
sprite.notes: This effect controller will either create a falling particle effect, or it will create a Sandstorm.

dependency.notes: If this sprite is placed more than once in the same Zone, the game will crash. If Sandstorm is selected, you must include [90] Wind Physics and Sound.

dualbox.comment: This determines the functionality of the sprite.

list.title: Falling Object Type
list.comment: This determines the particle effect used as stage decoration.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Kamek
sprite.notes:
Kamek himself can be placed anywhere within the Zone, as the controller's placement itself determines his spawn position.

The blocks move left and despawn when their right edges reach the left border, and respawn from their right edge on the right border.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

list.title: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the sprites model.

sprite.name: Cooligan Spawner
sprite.yoshinotes: Yoshi cannot jump on penguins, though he can use the stomp attack and tongue attack to defeat them.
sprite.notes: Pipes are not required for the spawner to work.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the Penguin will spawn from.

sprite.name: Bush
sprite.notes: A decorative leafy bush that appears behind Layer 1 terrain.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the Bush is a yellowish color, or if it uses the color listed in Bush Color instead.

list.title: Bush Style
list.comment: This determines the style of the Bush. The Forest Tree Leafs specifically are in front of Layer 1, but behind Layer 0.

list.title: Size
list.comment: This determines the size of the Bush. Larger sizes use different models.

sprite.name: Barrel
sprite.notes: A grabbable barrel that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will begin to roll until it hits an enemy or a wall. It can also hurt other players.

sprite.name: Lighting - Glow Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable glowing block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will bounce slightly. Its effect is severely dimished as anything other than a weapon of destruction if not using Full Darkness lighting.

list.title: Color
list.comment: A recolor for the Glow Block.
list.advancedcomment: More effects can be added for your hack.

value.title: Unknown Value 12
value.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 12 might affect something.

sprite.name: Propeller Block
sprite.notes: A grabbable propeller block that is affected by gravity. It can be picked up and thrown by shaking the controller next to it. It can also boost the player into the air like a Propeller Cap if the player shakes their controller a second time while holding it. If it is thrown and it hits the ground, it will bounce slightly.

list.title: NewerGEM: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the block's model.

sprite.name: Line Controlled ? Block
sprite.notes: A variant of the ? Block that will ride along Line objects.

dependency.notes: This sprite must be paired with a [236] Use Lines movement controller in order to function.

value.title: Line ID
value.comment: When pairing the block with sprite 236 and Lines, match the Line ID to enable Line controlled movement.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed that the block will travel along the Line.
list.comment2: Line Controlled objects use the same speed setting across all of them.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

sprite.name: Line Controlled Brick Block
sprite.notes: A variant of the Brick Block that will ride along Line objects.

dependency.notes: This sprite must be paired with a [236] Use Lines movement controller in order to function.

value.title: Line ID
value.comment: When pairing the block with sprite 236 and Lines, match the Line ID to enable Line controlled movement.

list.title: Speed
list.comment: This determines the speed that the block will travel along the Line.
list.comment2: Line Controlled objects use the same speed setting across all of them.

dualbox.comment: This determines which direction the block will move based on the Line that it is connected to.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release only one power-up item.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Bowser Jr. (2nd Battle)
sprite.notes: This controls the mechanics for the Second Bowser Jr. boss fight. The white square indicates the placement for the Airship Boss Cutscene controller. The cannon used in Newer's final boss fight is included on the clown car, but don't damage Bowser Jr.

dependency.notes: Specific room settings are likely required. Please reference the original Retail level, 06-38 A1.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Bowser Jr. (3rd Battle)
sprite.notes:
This controls the mechanics for the Third Bowser Jr. boss fight.

This fight crashes randomly in Newer.

dependency.notes: Specific room settings are likely required. Please reference the original Retail level, 08-38 A1.

sprite.name: (Unused) Toad House Minigame - Lives Balloon
sprite.notes: An unused version of sprite 412 and has no purpose.

sprite.name: Spike / Stone Spike
sprite.notes: A strange little koopa that can pull spiked balls from another dimension located inside their stomach and endlessly hurl them towards the player. These spiked balls cannot damage terrain.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Stone Spike.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines the color of the Spike.

dualbox.comment: This determines the type of enemy that will spawn.
dualbox.comment2: A Stone Spike throws spiked balls downwards, and a Spike throws spiked balls left or right.

dualbox.comment: This determines the initial direction the Spike will face.
dualbox.comment2: This has limited use, as the Spike will turn to face the player when needed. It's most useful when placing the Spike in range of an entrance.

checkbox.title: Always Throwing
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the Spike will always throw spiked balls, even when off-screen.
checkbox.comment2: May only function with Stone Spikes.

value.title: Throwing Delay
value.comment: This determines the delay between each time the Spike throws their spiked ball.
value.comment2: The amount of delay is inconsistent between increases in value.

sprite.name: Toad Needs Help - ? Block
sprite.notes: A feature used in Retail's Single Player where a Toad bubble will appear on the world map and signal that it needs rescued. Playing and completing that level by finding this Toad will award Mario three 1-Ups if he is carried to the goal flag in Super Form, and one 1-Up in Small Form. Also, when Toad is saved, a Toad House will open at the starting point of the world. The type of house that appears depends on the last digit in the time limit when Toad and/or Mario touches the flagpole.

dependency.notes: All normal levels can have a Toad Needs Help block and end up needing rescued, but they will not appear for Ghost House, Tower, Castle, or Airship levels.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.comment: ASM shows Nybble 12 might affect something.

checkbox.title: Always Toad in Block
checkbox.comment: Otherwise only appears when a Toad bubble appears on the map.

checkbox.title: Fake Block
checkbox.comment: Instead of giving us a Toad, make the block disappear with a boo laugh.

sprite.name: Toad Needs Help - Brick Block
sprite.notes: A feature used in Retail's Single Player where a Toad bubble will appear on the world map and signal that it needs rescued. Playing and completing that level by finding this Toad will award Mario three 1-Ups if he is carried to the goal flag in Super Form, and one 1-Up in Small Form. Also, when Toad is saved, a Toad House will open at the starting point of the world. The type of house that appears depends on the last digit in the time limit when Toad and/or Mario touches the flagpole.

dependency.notes: <font color="red">Usable in classic NSMBW only.</font> All normal levels can have a Toad Needs Help block and end up needing rescued, but they will not appear for Ghost House, Tower, Castle, or Airship levels.

checkbox.title: Unknown Flag 12 (1)
checkbox.advancedcomment: ASM shows Nybble 12 might affect something.

sprite.name: Palm Tree
sprite.notes: A palm tree decoration with a solid-on-top collision.

list.title: Height
list.comment: This determines the height of the Palm Tree.

list.title: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the sprites model.

sprite.name: Kamek
sprite.notes: Requires his boss controller to function. His spawn position is fixed relative to the boss controller's position, making the placement of the sprite itself irrelevant.

dependency.notes: For more help setting up the boss room, see the zone from the original game.

list.title: SpriteTex
list.comment: Changes the sprites model.

sprite.name: Boss Controller - Bowser
sprite.notes: The main boss controller for the Retail Bowser battle.

dependency.notes: Most of the final Bowser fight involves hardcoded elements, some of which that were removed in Newer. Directly copying 08-24 A4 from Newer is strongly recommended. Sprites won't spawn if on screen when entering the zone.

sprite.name: Floating ? Block
sprite.notes: A slightly-larger-than-normal ? Block that floats on the surface of the Zone's non-Location Water, Poisoned Water, or Lava.

dependency.notes: Place this block at the horizontal position you want it to load, and it will spawn floating at the surface line of the body of liquid. It only works with non-Location liquids, and it does work with Moving liquids.

list.title: Block Contains
list.comment: This determines what item the block contains.
list.comment2: This block will release as many items as there are players.

sprite.name: Mushroom Platform
sprite.notes: A mushroom platform with a solid-on-top collision representing the top segment of a large mushroom. The stem portion must be painted with tileset objects.

dualbox.comment: This determines the thickness (style) of the mushroom platform.
This determines the color of the Skinny mushroom platform.
This determines the color of the Thick mushroom platform.

value.title: Width
value.comment: This determines the width of the mushroom platform.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the mushroom platform is flat and horizontal, or if it is tilted at an angle.
This determines which direction the mushroom platform will be angled.

list.title: Angle
list.comment: Angles greater than 45° have glitchy collision and are not recommended.

list.title: Angle
list.comment: Angles greater than 45° have glitchy collision and are not recommended.

checkbox.title: Place In Front Of Other Sprites
checkbox.comment: When enabled, this changes the relative Z-Order of the platform placing it in front of other sprites.
checkbox.comment2: The player will jump behind the mushroom platform when passing through from underneath.

sprite.name: Lighting - Underwater Lamp
sprite.notes: A decorative aquatic lamp that generates light around it. It has no collision by default. It does not have to be used with water, it just happens to have a ship motif.

value.title: Model ID
value.comment: This determines the model used by the lamp. <font color="blue">For use with "New Super Mario Bros. Wii: The Prankster Comets" Only!</font>
value.advancedcomment:
If the Model ID is set to 0, the model that will be used will be "shinkai_light.mdl0".
Otherwise, say x is the Model ID, the model that will be used will be "shinkai_light_x.mdl0".

list.title: Power
list.comment: This determines the power of the light emmited by the sprite. 100% = 266 units = 16.625 tiles.

sprite.name: Bowser Switch (Small)
sprite.notes: This switch is nearly identical to the Red ! Switch, but it does not activate outlined Red Blocks. It may have additional bugs. Not recommended for use outside of the final Bowser Boss fight.

dependency.notes: This sprite has additional hardcoded behavior that may cause bugs when it is used outside of its intended boss fight.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines what color the switch is. Different colored switches do not activate different colors of blocks.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be movable by environmental factors, such as dropping down when bricks below it are destroyed, or moving along platforms.
checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Red Blocks will not become solid.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

list.title: Delay on Multi-Use
list.comment: This determines how long the switch will take to pop up after the timer expires on a Timed Multi-Use switch.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: This switch will not be visible if a Triggering Event is defined unless that event is activated.
value.advancedcomment: Using a Triggering ID with Multi-Use functionality is somewhat glitchy and not recommended.

sprite.name: Bowser Switch (Large)
sprite.notes: A much larger, fancier switch that was originally used for the final Bowser Boss fight, and Switch Palaces. It always flashes red.

dependency.notes: This sprite has additional hardcoded behavior that may cause bugs when it is used outside of its intended boss fight. Known bugs: It is incompatible with Multi-Use. The Target Event ID must be unique to this Switch.

list.title: Color
list.comment: This determines what color the switch is. Different colored switches do not activate different colors of blocks.
list.comment2: [Bug] All color values other than the original will spawn one block further upwards than it should. This is accounted for in the sprite image.

checkbox.title: Upside-Down
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will be facing downwards.
checkbox.comment2: Upside-Down switches cannot be set to fall.

checkbox.title: Falls

checkbox.comment2: Conveyor belts cannot move Switches, even when [Falls] is set.

value.title: Target Event ID
value.comment: This event will be modified when the switch is pressed. An event is not required if simply using the switch to activate Red Blocks.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
dualbox.comment2: The Target Event will be modified to the opposite state when the Timed effect expires.

dualbox.comment: This determines how the Target Event is modified.
This determines if the Target Event is modified temporarily or permanently.
dualbox.comment2: Permanent Event cannot be used with Multi-Use. Additionally, Permanent Event will also permanently deactivate the background music for the zone, and Red Blocks will not become solid.

checkbox.title: Disable Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not interrupt the normal level music with Timed music. This setting is only applicable if Timed Event is set.

checkbox.title: Disable Permanent Music Interruption
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will not disable the background music. This setting is highly recommended if Permanent Event is set.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the switch will pop back up when the Timed effect expires.
dualbox.comment2:
Single Use: The switch will vanish entirely after pressed.

Multi-Use: The switch will enter a flat state. When the Timed effect expires, the switch will pop back up following the Delay setting.
dualbox.advancedcomment:
If the Target Event is deactivated/activated by another method, Multi-Use switches will flatten or pop-up on their own.

The pop up effect can be used to launch the player much higher than they could normally jump.

checkbox.title: Loads at Midway
checkbox.comment: When enabled, the switch will only appear if the level has been loaded from a Midway point.

value.title: Triggering Event ID

sprite.name: Goal Object

sprite.notes: This creates immobile 'Dragon Coaster' Platforms (1x2). The Sprite's placement represents the right side of the Platform.

dependency.notes: The normal Dragon Coaster [297] must be placed somewhere in your level. It does not have to be part of a zone.

dualbox.comment: This determines if the platform is flat (horizontal), or if it is tilted at an angle.
This determines which direction the platform will be angled.

list.comment2: Angles greater than 45° have glitchy collision and are not recommended.

sprite.name: Event Block
sprite.notes: A red or green block that, when struck, will affect the state of the Target Event(s). Events that are deactivated will become activated, and those that are activated will become deactivated.
sprite.advancednotes: Kamek code references the events by the opposite number.

dualbox.comment: This determines which associated Event IDs will be affected when the block is struck.
dualbox.comment2:
If set to Affect Event 1, Event 1 will be activated or deactivated and the color of the block will display the state of Event 1, green for on and red for off.

If set to Swap Events, Event 2 will be activated initially and Event 1 will be deactivated initially during the Zone loading. The color of the block will rely on Event 2's current state.

sprite.name: Actor Spawner
sprite.notes:
With this sprite, you can spawn anything and everything that exists in the game. Sprite Data can be applied to sprites spawned through this within certain limitations. Please utilize Raw Data (Visible with Advanced Settings enabled) to determine what the settings should be set to. Combine the Actor Spawner with [332] Effect/Sound Spawner to add flair to the spawn effect.

Additionally, anything spawned by the Actor Spawner will need to be respawned each time the player changes Zones. If returning from a bonus room, be sure to trigger any relevant spawns. Each Actor Spawner can only trigger once each Zone.

dependency.notes: Directly place any sprite you want to spawn with the Actor Spawner somewhere in your level for the game to load the required secondary assets of that sprite.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: When this event is activated, the Actor Spawner will create one copy of the Actor at the location of the Spawner. Keep in mind that some sprites have abnormal placement so expect a lot of testing to make sure that everything works correctly.
value.comment2: The Triggering Event ID is limited to only the first 15 Event IDs.

checkbox.title: Automatically Respawn
checkbox.comment: When the actor spawned by this spawner is deleted or missing, and the event is triggered, another actor with the same settings will be spawened. This also stops the spawned actor from despawning when the event is deactivated.

value.title: Actor ID - Number Entry
value.comment: Please enter the extension that you wish to dial. If your party cannot be reached, please dial a different number. Thank you.
value.comment2: Do not use an Actor ID that does not return a value on the list below.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your Actor ID.

sprite.name: Actor Multi-Spawner
sprite.notes:
With this sprite, you can spawn anything and everything that exists in the game. It will spawn the Actor every 2 seconds while the Triggering Event is on. If you need to spawn them at a faster rate, use an Event Controller to deactivate and activate the Triggering Event. Sprite Data can be applied to sprites spawned through this within certain limitations. Please utilize Raw Data (Visible with Advanced Settings enabled) to determine what the settings should be set to. Combine the Actor Spawner with [332] Effect/Sound Spawner to add flair to the spawn effect.

Additionally, anything spawned by the Actor Spawner will need to be respawned each time the player changes Zones. If returning from a bonus room, be sure to trigger any relevant spawns. Each Actor Spawner can only trigger once each Zone.

dependency.notes: Directly place any sprite you want to spawn with the Actor Spawner somewhere in your level for the game to load the required secondary assets of that sprite.

value.title: Triggering Event ID
value.comment: While this event is activated, the Actor Spawner will create a copy of the Actor every 2 seconds at the location of the Spawner. Keep in mind that some sprites have abnormal placement so expect a lot of testing to make sure that everything works correctly.
value.comment2: The Triggering Event ID is limited to only the first 15 Event IDs.

value.title: Actor ID - Number Entry
value.comment: Please enter the extension that you wish to dial. If your party cannot be reached, please dial a different number. Thank you.
value.comment2: Do not use an Actor ID that does not return a value on one of the lists below.

external.title: Actor ID
external.comment: Use this external window to select your actor id.

sprite.notes: A Thorny Flower from SMG.

sprite.name: Custom Model Loader
sprite.notes:
The Custom Model Loader allows the use of pre-scripted Models and Animations for use in user-created cutscenes. It can also provide new models as decoration for your level.

Warning: Will CRASH if [Animate Model] is set and no animation is available.
sprite.advancednotes: New Models and Animations can be added to this sprite's functionality specifically for your hack. This requires editing of the game code through Kamek or with the assistance of members of the NEWER team.

value.title: Scale: Value/4.0
value.comment: This determines the scale of the Model.
value.comment2: Value 0 creates an original-sized Model (100%). Values above 0 are divided by 4 to determine the Model Size. 1=25%, 2=50%, 8=200%, etc.
value.advancedcomment: Value limit unknown. Maximum value suspected to be 24, or 600%

list.title: Z-Order
list.comment: This determines the Z-Order of the model.
list.comment2:
Some in-game Z-Order values:
Background: -5500.0
Layer 2: -3300.0
Layer 1: 0.0
Player: 300.0
Foreground: 1200.0
Layer 0: 3300.0
Above Layer 0: 5500.0
list.entry: Use Default Z-Order for Custom Model

value.advancedcomment: Value limit unknown. Maximum value suspected to be 24, or 600%

sprite.name: Jumbo Ray Respawner 2
sprite.notes: A controller that will respawn or otherwise spawn additional Jumbo Rays.

value.title: Ray ID
value.comment: This determines which Jumbo Rays will be respawned by this controller.

value.title: Spawn Delay While Ridden
value.comment: This determines how soon after the launch of the initial Jumbo Ray that another one will be spawned. Used whenever at least one Ray is being ridden by a player.
value.comment2: A value of 16 is equal to about the width of one Jumbo Ray. <font color="red">Do not use a value of 0 or the game will crash.</font>

value.title: Spawn Delay While Not Ridden
value.comment: Used instead of the other Spawn Delay whenever no Rays are currently being ridden.
